results.title: It's up to us
results.brief_description: The Intellectual Disability Rights service have produced this video to help disabled people to deal with rights and responsibilities at work. It includes issues such as safety, sexual harrassment, the right to be treated fairly, the right to choose your own friends and to have relationships. The second section looks at why people may want a workers committee and how one group of workers set one up.

results.title: Amongst equals
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Paul Hamfess and Jotz Productions
results.brief_description: Documents the history of the Australian Trade Union Movement. The film is not endorsed by the ACTU and represents only the film maker’s view. The 1850s saw the introduction of the eight hour labour movement and the subsequent development of the trade union movement. Unions were established to organise, assert and defend the worker’s rights, industrial awards, occupational health and safety and minimum wages.

results.title: Aboriginal dreaming stories
results.brief_description: Jointly presented by Francis Firebrace Jones and Paulin Mcleod, these stories are presented with great enthusiasm and in the spirit of enhancing respect for the land and the Aboriginal people of Australia. The story titles are: In the beginning ; Creation of day and night ; Who discovered Australia? ; How fire came to Earth ; Giant Goanna and the Little black snake ; Why does the kookaburra laugh ; Old bush turkey ; Sharing time ; How the kangaroo got its pouch ; The Platypus ; Death of a cockatoo ; Walkabout ; The Bunyip ; “the Wallagara Man.

results.title: Play Safe
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Australian Road Safety Council and Video Films
results.brief_description: Aimed at children, this film highlights a number of road safety aspects. Don Bradman talks to the children about avoiding accidents, both going and coming from school, and during playtime on the school playground.

results.title: The Bad society
results.brief_description: In December 1976, 16,000 people converged at the Cotter River in Canberra for the “Down to earth” festival; a conference on alternative lifestyles. In attendance were Reverend George Davies, Dr. Jim Cairns, Dr. Jim Falk as well as thousands of counter culture followers. This documentary explores the festival and the themes of politics and social change. The Philisophy of Ex Deputy Prime Minister, Dr. Jim Cairns is particularly focussed on with its emphasis on how a nation state creates a ‘bad society’ and how communal life and a counter culture lifestyle forms the only radicalism against society.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 1
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This program contains the following topics: Magic; number 3; working as a stockman; reading of “The Man and the tree”; number 1; blowing noses; letter “M”; making hairstring; words for ‘wide’ and ‘narrow’; car magic; bat and ball magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 2
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Working for the Yuendumu Mining Co.; reading of “The Story of the Perentie”; words for ‘far’ and ‘close’; cleaning teeth, washing eyes; fire-making; story about a little kangaroo looking for its mother; shirt magic; number 2. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 4
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Magic; spear-straightening in a fire and hunting for kangaroo; baby magic; words for ‘big’ and ‘little’ using different clothes being washed; collecting red ochre form a cave at Karrku, near Nyirrpi; working at the powerhouse; picking up rubbish; reading of “The Snake and the Goanna”; band magic; Nyirrpi tractor. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 5
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Holly magic; words for ‘happy’ and ‘serious’; reading of a “Story about Echidnas”’ number 8; story about a bush potato dreaming place; more on numbers, using doll magic; dreaming stories about places southwest of Yuendumu; boys and girls painted up and doing fire-dreaming dances; good food; bush animals, vegetables, fruits and seeds; working at the shop; bike magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
